section.p: This documentation provides comprehensive guidance for using Lingua Workbench, a personal language learning platform for studying spoken English from authentic audio sources.
This guide is intended for:

ul.li: Language learners who want to improve their English listening skills through TV shows and movies
Developers who want to set up and customize the platform
Contributors who want to understand the system architecture

section.p: This guide is divided into the following parts:

ul.li: Getting Started Installation and first-run instructions
User Guide Step-by-step procedures for using all features
Reference Lookup information for controls, tags, and technical details
Troubleshooting Solutions to common problems
Appendix Additional reference materials

section.p: This documentation uses the following conventions:

ul.li: Bold text in boxes indicates UI buttons or controls
Monospace text indicates code, commands, or file paths
Bold text indicates important terms or emphasis

section.p: Copyright 2026 Edith Tang. All rights reserved.
This documentation is provided for personal and educational use only.

ul.li: Vue.js is a trademark of Evan You.
Django is a registered trademark of the Django Software Foundation.
OpenAI and Whisper are trademarks of OpenAI, Inc.
All other trademarks are the property of their respective owners.

section.p: This application uses the following third-party services:

ul.li: OpenAI API For phonetic analysis and dictionary features
Whisper API For speech-to-text transcription

section.p: Usage of these services is subject to their respective terms of service and pricing.
This software is provided "as is" without warranty of any kind. The author is not responsible for any damages arising from the use of this software.

div.p: This section documents the revision history of Lingua Workbench.

ul.li: Initial release
Audio management (upload, chunk, slice)
Whisper transcription integration
AI phonetic analysis (Sound Script)
Dictionary with bilingual examples
Playback speed control
Favorite marking
Time adjustment arrows
Independent slice deletion

div.p: Lingua Workbench is a personal language learning platform for studying spoken English.

section.p: Lingua Workbench helps you analyze and study spoken English from audio sources like TV shows and movies. It provides tools for:

ul.li: Uploading and managing audio files organized by drama/season/episode
Creating precise audio slices from longer recordings
AI-powered transcription and phonetic analysis
Context-aware dictionary lookups

section.p: The platform includes:

ul.li: Audio Slicer - Interactive waveform selection and region management
Sound Script Analysis - AI-generated phonetic breakdown of phrases
Dictionary Integration - Bilingual definitions with contextual examples
Playback Controls - Variable speed, loop, and region playback

section.p: This tool is designed for English learners who want to master natural spoken English through authentic audio sources.

div.p: Set up the development environment for Lingua Workbench.

section.p: Before you begin, ensure you have:

ul.li: Node.js 20+ or 22+
Python 3.11+
ffmpeg (for audio processing)
Git

section.p: Lingua Workbench consists of a Vue 3 frontend and Django backend. Both need to be set up separately.

div.span: Create environment files with your API keys.

section.p: Both frontend and backend are now ready to run.

div.domains: (map mapgroup-d) (map bookmap) (topic abbrev-d) (topic delay-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (map ditavalref-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic xnal-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)

div.p: Start the development servers and access the application.

section.p: Complete the installation (on page ) first.

li.span: Start the backend server:

pre.code: cd backend venv\Scripts\activate python manage.py runserver

li.div: The Django server starts on http://localhost:8000

li.span: In a new terminal, start the frontend:
li.div: The Vite dev server starts on http://localhost:5173

li.span: Open your browser and navigate to http://localhost:5173

section.p: You should see the Lingua Workbench home page. You can now start uploading audio and creating slices.

div.domains: (map mapgroup-d) (map bookmap) (topic abbrev-d) (topic delay-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (map ditavalref-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic xnal-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)

div.p: Understanding how audio is organized and processed in Lingua Workbench.

section.p: Audio in Lingua Workbench is organized in three levels:

ol.li: Source Audio - The original uploaded file, organized by Drama Season Episode
Audio Chunks - Automatically created 5-minute segments of the source audio
Audio Slices - User-created regions within chunks for focused study

section.p: When you upload an audio file:

ol.li: The file is stored and associated with a drama/episode
It is automatically split into 5-minute chunks
You can then browse chunks and create slices for study

div.p: Upload an audio file from a TV show or movie.

section.p: You need an audio file in MP3 or WAV format.

li.span: Navigate to the Audio Upload page.
Select or create a Drama (e.g., "Friends").
Enter the Season and Episode numbers.
Optionally add an episode title.
Click Choose File and select your audio file.
Click Upload.

section.p: The audio is uploaded and automatically chunked. You can now browse the chunks.

div.p: View and select audio chunks for slice creation.

li.span: Navigate to the Audio Workbench page.
Use the filter to select a drama or episode.
Click on a chunk card to open it in the Audio Slicer.

section.p: The waveform is displayed and you can begin creating slices.

div.domains: (map mapgroup-d) (map bookmap) (topic abbrev-d) (topic delay-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (map ditavalref-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic xnal-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)

div.p: Understanding audio slices and their role in language learning.

section.p: An audio slice is a user-defined region within an audio chunk. Each slice represents a meaningful utterance, sentence, or phrase that you want to study.
Each slice contains:

ul.li: Time boundaries - Start and end times within the chunk
Transcription - The text content (via Whisper or manual input)
Highlights - Selected text portions for phonetic analysis
Favorite flag - Mark important sentences for review
Keep slices focused on single sentences or short exchanges
Use the time adjustment arrows to fine-tune boundaries
Star slices that contain challenging pronunciations

div.p: Select a region on the waveform to create an audio slice.

section.p: You must have an audio chunk open in the Audio Slicer.

li.span: Click and drag on the waveform to select a region.
li.div: The selected region is highlighted in blue.

li.span: Release the mouse button to create the slice.
li.div: A new SliceCard appears in the panel below.

li.span: Fine-tune the boundaries using the and arrows on the timestamp.
li.div: Each click adjusts the time by 0.5 seconds.

section.p: The slice is created locally. Use Save All Changes to persist to the server.

div.p: Use AI to automatically transcribe the audio in a slice.

li.span: Locate the slice you want to transcribe.
Click the Transcribe button (microphone icon).
li.div: The button shows a loading indicator while processing.

li.span: Wait for the transcription to complete.
li.div: The transcribed text appears in the slice card.

li.span: Click the edit button to correct any transcription errors.

section.p: The slice now contains the transcribed text, ready for highlighting and analysis.

div.p: Manually edit the transcription text of a slice.

li.span: Click the edit button (pencil icon) at the bottom-right of the text area.
li.div: The text becomes editable in a textarea.

li.span: Make your changes to the text.
Click the save button (floppy disk icon) to save changes.
Click the cancel button (X icon) to discard changes.

div.p: Remove a slice from your collection.

section.p: Deleting a saved slice immediately removes it from the server. This action cannot be undone.

div.span: Click the delete button (trash icon) on the slice card.

section.p: For saved slices, the deletion is immediate. For unsaved slices, only the local region is removed.

div.domains: (map mapgroup-d) (map bookmap) (topic abbrev-d) (topic delay-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (map ditavalref-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic xnal-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)

div.p: Understanding AI-generated phonetic analysis.

section.p: Sound Script is an AI-generated phonetic breakdown of spoken English phrases. It analyzes how words are actually pronounced in connected speech, identifying:

ul.li: Reductions - Vowels weakening to schwa sounds
Linking - Words connecting across boundaries
Assimilations - Sounds changing due to neighboring sounds
Deletions - Sounds that are dropped (h-deletion, t-deletion)

section.p: The sound_display shows pronunciation using:

ul.li: Phonetic spelling (e.g., "wuh-duh-we" for "what do we")
Square brackets for ghost/silent sounds: [t]uh
Hyphens to show syllable/word boundaries

section.p: The UI displays pronunciation above the original text using Ruby annotation, making it easy to compare written and spoken forms.

div.p: Select a phrase to analyze its pronunciation.

section.p: The slice must have transcribed text.

li.span: Select text in the slice by clicking and dragging.
li.div: A highlighter icon appears near your selection.

li.span: Click the highlighter icon to create a highlight.
li.div: The text is highlighted and the Highlight Editor opens below.

section.p: The highlight is created and you can now request AI analysis.

div.p: Request phonetic analysis for a highlighted phrase.

section.p: You must have a highlight selected.

li.span: With a highlight active, click the Analyze button in the Highlight Editor.
li.div: The AI processes the phrase and returns analysis.

li.span: Review the phonetic tags and sound display.

section.p: The analysis shows phonetic breakdown with Ruby text annotations above the original text.

div.p: Correct or refine the AI's pronunciation analysis.

section.p: Sometimes the AI makes mistakes in phonetic analysis. You can manually correct the sound_display values.

li.span: Switch to Sound Display mode by clicking the mode toggle button.
Click on a segment to select it for editing.
li.div: The segment's sound_display appears in the input field.

li.span: Edit the pronunciation text.
Click Save to apply changes.

div.p: Get dictionary definitions for a highlighted phrase.

li.span: With a highlight active, click the Dictionary button.
Review the definition and example sentences.

section.p: The dictionary panel shows bilingual definitions with contextual examples.

div.p: Generate new example sentences for a dictionary entry.

div.span: In the Dictionary panel, click the Refresh button.

section.p: The AI generates new contextual examples in both English and Chinese.

div.p: Reference for all controls available on a SliceCard.

tr.td: Send audio to Whisper for transcription
Remove the slice (immediate for saved slices)

div.p: Reference for audio playback controls.

section.p: Available playback speeds: 0.5x, 0.75x, 1.0x (normal), 1.25x, 1.5x
When enabled, the active region plays repeatedly until stopped.
Click on a SliceCard to play that region only.

div.p: Reference for Highlight Editor modes.

section.p: Displays phonetic tags with their notes. Click a tag to edit its annotation.
Displays script segments in format: [original] sound_display. Click a segment to edit its pronunciation.
Click the mode toggle button to switch between the two modes.

div.p: Reference for phonetic tag types used in analysis.

tr.td: Sound changes due to adjacent sounds

div.p: Understanding the notation for silent or omitted sounds.

section.p: Sounds enclosed in square brackets [x] represent "ghost sounds" - phonemes that are weakened or omitted in natural speech.
Ghost sounds are displayed with strikethrough styling and reduced opacity in the UI.

article.class: - topic/topic task/task topic task nested1 troubleshooting

div.p: Resolve issues with Whisper transcription.

section.p: Symptom: Clicking the Transcribe button results in empty text or an error.

li.span: Check that the Whisper service is running.
li.div: Ensure the Whisper API container is started.

li.span: Verify the audio region is not empty.
li.div: The selected region must contain audible speech.

li.span: Check browser console for errors.
li.div: Network or API errors will appear in the console.

li.span: Ensure the audio format is supported (MP3, WAV).

div.domains: (map mapgroup-d) (map bookmap) (topic abbrev-d) (topic delay-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (map ditavalref-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic xnal-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)

article.class: - topic/topic task/task topic task nested1 troubleshooting

div.p: Resolve issues with phonetic analysis.

section.p: Symptom: Analysis fails or returns unexpected results.

li.span: Check your OpenAI API key is valid and has credits.
Ensure the highlighted text is meaningful (not just punctuation).
Try a shorter phrase if the text is very long.
Check the Django server logs for API errors.
